title: Costs of external consequences of cyber attacks on businesses 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
The highest Category Information loss has 5.4 more Cost in million U.S. dollars than the lowest Category Revenue loss.
min_summary: This bar chart has 4 columns on the x axis representing Category, and Cost in million U.S. dollars in each Category on the y axis.
The maximum Cost in million U.S. dollars 5.9 is found at Category Information loss and the minimum is found at Revenue loss where Category is 0.5.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Category in the x axis and Cost in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is highest at Category Information loss and lowest at Category Revenue loss.
The highest Category Information loss has 5.4 more Cost in million U.S. dollars than the lowest Category Revenue loss.
max_summary: This bar chart has 4 columns on the x axis representing Category, and Cost in million U.S. dollars in each Category on the y axis.
The maximum Cost in million U.S. dollars 5.9 is found at Category Information loss and the minimum is found at Revenue loss where Category is 0.5.
The second highest Cost in million U.S. dollars is appeared to be the Category Business disruption.
The highest Category Information loss has 5.4 more Cost in million U.S. dollars than the lowest Category Revenue loss.
Category Information loss is higher than any other Categorys with value 5.9, followed by Business disruption, and Equipment damages. Down to Category Revenue loss with the lowest value 0.5.
The highest value 5.9 at Information loss is almost 1.82 times larger than the average value 3.25.
The Cost in million U.S. dollars is 13.0 if we add up values of all Categorys.
